member.name: T:Pri.Essentials.Abstractions.IFileSystem
member.summary: Provides an abstraction for file system operations, including checking for the existence of files and directories and deleting files.
member.remarks: Implementations of this interface allow code to interact with the file system in a platform-independent manner, which is useful for testing and for supporting multiple storage backends. Methods may throw exceptions if invalid paths are provided or if operations fail due to permissions or other file system errors.

member.name: M:Pri.Essentials.Abstractions.IFileSystem.Exists(System.String)
member.summary: Determines whether the specified path refers to an existing file or directory.
member.param: The path to the file or directory to check. This can be either an absolute or relative path. Cannot be null or empty.
member.returns: true if the specified path exists as a file or directory; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Pri.Essentials.Abstractions.IFileSystem.FileExists(System.String)
member.summary: Determines whether the specified file exists at the given path.
member.remarks: This method only checks for the existence of a file, not a directory. The result may be affected by file system permissions or concurrent changes to the file system.
member.param: The path to the file to check for existence. This can be either a relative or absolute path. Cannot be null or an empty string.
member.returns: true if a file exists at the specified path; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Pri.Essentials.Abstractions.IFileSystem.DirectoryExists(System.String)
member.summary: Determines whether the specified path refers to an existing directory.
member.remarks: This method does not validate whether the path is a file or a directory; it only checks for the existence of a directory at the specified path. No exception is thrown if the directory does not exist or the path is invalid.
member.param: The path to the directory to check. The path can be relative or absolute. Cannot be null, empty, or contain invalid characters.
member.returns: true if the specified path refers to an existing directory; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Pri.Essentials.Abstractions.IFileSystem.DeleteFile(System.String)
member.summary: Deletes the specified file from the file system.
member.remarks: If the file does not exist, no exception is thrown. This method does not delete directories. Relative paths are interpreted relative to the current working directory.
member.param: The path to the file to be deleted. The path must refer to an existing file and cannot be null, empty, or contain invalid characters.

member.name: M:Pri.Essentials.Abstractions.IFileSystem.FileOpen(System.String,System.IO.FileMode,System.IO.FileAccess,System.IO.FileShare)
member.summary: Opens a file stream for the specified file with the given mode, access, and sharing options.
